intro: Zoegea leptaurea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved zoegea, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrowly elliptical in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, clustered in small umbels, and are accompanied by stipules that are often lobed or toothed. Zoegea leptaurea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
